tweets.text:
The @WWT_online Water Security Conference 2021 will see speakers from @BristolWater @AffinityWater @EnvAgency  @SouthernWater and @Waterwise unite to discuss the key issues surrounding water security.

Download the brochure here: https://t.co/Uf1KKGfbiK #watersecurity21 https://t.co/189w10kGQn

Phase1 @WildTroutTrust & Kilnsey AC. White Beck #Wharfe protected from livestock so riparian flora can develop + tree planting (thanks @kilnseypark @TCVtweets #IDigTrees).
Phase2 in-channel spawning & fry habitat funded by @EnvAgencyYNE #FIP & WTT's @YorkshireWater TROUT project https://t.co/uwDSw57FWH

Need some #MondayMotivation today? 

Check out Cohort 5 BGFer Gemma's great new blog post about #water: https://t.co/uMKSiR4rGa

And if that gets you in the mood: @OBrightFuture and @EnvAgency are hosting a youth event on water tmrw: join!  https://t.co/DW3PA6ewFa

üíß https://t.co/Ip34IhSYMm

urls.title: Gemma's water blog
urls.description: Cohort 5 BGFer Gemma has written an awesome post for the Our Bright Future Blog exploring how water has impacted her local area and the future solutions that could help York adapt to higher river levels. She has kindly let us reproduce the blog post below... Water. Water is a substance we often overlook and ignore but it can be the source of life itself or the source of great tragedy and sorrow. The city of York, found in the north of England, has been built around the River Ouse which flows rig

urls.title: Youth Voice Summit - Rethinking Water
urls.description: A chance for you to input your opinions and experiences on future water management and how you would like to engage in giving your opinion in the decisions made by the Environment Agency in the future.

tweets.text: The @EnvAgency #UK has contracted #Dutch dredging firm Van Oord to continue to protect the Lincolnshire coast for the next four years. Meeting the @EnvAgency zero #carbon goals, the dredger HAM316 will run on #sustainable  #biofuel. https://t.co/lo8hXcPkpS https://t.co/KGmaxiTk6h

urls.title: icon-calendar
urls.description: Dredging firm Van Oord has been contracted by the Environment Agency to continue to protect the Lincolnshire coast of the UK for the next four years.¬†For these nourishments, Van Oord will continue to deploy its trailing hopper suction dredger HAM 316 that is powered by biofuel.

tweets.text: Our Fisheries Enforcement Support Service and Voluntary Bailiff Service will be delivering Operation Clampdown 9 in partnership with the @EnvAgency during the coarse fish close season that starts this Monday 15th March and runs until 15th June. Read more: https://t.co/mzFL2CT6qM

The R. Misbourne at Bottom House Lane today, full of sewage and reeking to high heaven. Globally rare #chalkstream in the heart of the @ChilternsAONB @EnvAgency @ChilternSociety @Feargal_Sharkey @thameswater https://t.co/4Hr8tBwuBq

Find out why the #angling #CloseSeason is so important for coarse #fish with #EastMidlands Fisheries Technical Specialist @MattBuckEA 

It starts today, meaning it‚Äôs illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15 June inclusive.  

Read more üëâ https://t.co/5MiJkOiH84 https://t.co/jc9GebcSXb

urls.title: Start of the close season: How do we protect our breeding fish at this time of year?
urls.description: Matt Buck, Fisheries Technical Specialist for the Midlands, explains how close season helps protect our breeding fish. Well the evenings are getting lighter, and across the country fish are starting to move out of their winter haunts - a sure ‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
Oh dear.

QC has a view that the @EnvAgency must proactively safeguard SSSIs, SACs from harm, like abstraction.

CEO of EA says no we don't.

Just days later @Defra issue guidance to the EA "You MUST NOT WAIT until a site is harmed to put conservation measures in place." Oops. https://t.co/elg6fIrmQs

The coarse fish #CloseSeason starts today, meaning it‚Äôs illegal to fish for coarse fish in rivers until 15 June inclusive.  

We spoke to Fisheries Officer Matt Buck to find out why the close season is so important üëá

More info: https://t.co/u6IhTpkgUB #Angling https://t.co/wVVj0shIow

tweets.text: @OBrightFuture @EnvAgency @TNLComFund @EmmaHowardBoyd @PetaFoxall Looking forward to seeing everyone there!

@RussellB1ggs @EnvAgencyAnglia Yes. Didn‚Äôt @EnvAgency use some tyre bales as a ‚Äòcheap‚Äô solution to bank side erosion? Not so cheap when they start popping the cheaply galvanised straps. Should be due falling out of river embankments any time soon.
@Feargal_Sharkey Luckily the @EnvAgency will be springing into action... no?

Our NatureBid auction is now open and closes on Sun 28th!

Landowners and farmers in the Upper Aire, you can now submit your funding bids for natural flood management and water quality improvement.

More info here: https://t.co/VBYg2SVtNR

@EnvAgencyYNE @SylvaFoundation https://t.co/6h5Y8bzWt2

urls.title: NatureBid project to improve water quality and flood management | Yorkshire Wildlife Trust
urls.description: We are pleased to announce a new pilot project which awards funding to landowners in the Upper Aire to improve water quality and flood management.

Well, here we go: On camera, in front of 2 TV Police Officers here‚Äôs your confirmation - 1 nest box removed that they won‚Äôt show me the contents of (I‚Äôve filmed Blue Tits in and out), 2nd nest box removed and the climber tells me there‚Äôs moss inside. ACTIVE NEST REMOVED! CRIME! https://t.co/U4C1BpOLUG

#OxfordFloodScheme works with the natural floodplain to the west of #Oxford üåä
We'll lower the ground level creating a new stream and wetland - this creates more space for water, reducing flood risk to homes and businesses

#Oxfordshire https://t.co/Zd7EBpOEwN

urls.title: Oxford Flood Scheme
urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We‚Äôd like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services. We also use cookies set by other sites to help us deliver content from their services. Where we have identified any third party copyright information you will need to obtain permission from the copyright holders concerned. This publication is available at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/oxford-flood-scheme/oxford-flo
